long_description: $F$ is a permutation keyed by a key $k \in \{0,1\}^s$, and maintains all of the properties of a pseudorandom function, except that $F$ is a bijection from $\{0,1\}^n$ to $\{0,1\}^n$, and is invertible in polynomial time given $k$.  Without $k$, $F$ is indistinguishable from a random permutation mapping $\{0,1\}^n \rightarrow \{0,1\}^n$.
